reviews.review_msg: Halil was not too bad of a professor. He seemed like a nice guy, but he was just not the best at thoroughly explaining concepts. The projects themselves were fine, however the final was very confusing. Some of the questions that were asked were never discussed in lecture and were worded very weirdly.

I would advise that if you have him for 106, get a critique from your TA for your final project before submitting, as Halil likes to make up last minute specifics that weren't clearly outlined in the rubric. Try to do your best everywhere else because your grade is gonna go down after the final because it looks nothing like the assigned lectures.

This guy thinks he's so funny. He thinks he's the riddler. A true jester at that. Had way too high expectations for the projects, like I'm sorry I'm not a passionate architecture bro. TAs weren't helpful either. His final exam literally felt like those class vs homework vs exam memes. It consisted more of english comprehension/MACM than 106 itself.

Feels like Halil doesn't really care about his students. He doesn't notice when they have fallen behind, and doesn't seem to put any efforts into potentially helping them. He is condescending towards students' work, and is unhelpful when you ask for help or feedback. Both his and the TAs overall demeanour is discouraging.The class could've been fun

Gives helpful tutorials but not a fan of his teaching style. Likes to pick students to answer questions and includes group discussions during lecture which I find to be ineffective for learning the material and a bit of a time staller. Did not seem to have a habit of giving constructive feedback and was condescending towards student projects.

The worst professor I've ever had. Beyond having quiz questions that are unrelated to his lecture and poor communication with his TA's, he is straight up rude. Snapping at people to walk faster to the front to start their presentations, VAGUE grading criteria that all of sudden gets specified after handing things in, just overall low vibrational.

may god forgive halil because i will not. literally watched him break someone's project during final pres. barely communicates instructions and when you ask him questions he treats you like a little kid who doesn't know how to read. ta's dont care or respond to emails ever and neither does he. also always looks like he just rolled out of bed

Extremely vague with project criteria, and he communicates poorly between his TA's. If you approach him with a comment or concern you'll be met with rude and unhelpful responses. He as a person, and his teaching methods are both lackluster.

Make sure you pick good partners for the group projects.
He has unclear grading criteria and if you ask him to clarify he will say "read the description".... even though the description was unclear. Very unhelpful and inconsiderate

Halil was ok. He may have read some of the reviews from previous years and improved his teaching style, he was pretty coordinated and seemed fairly engaging when I took his class. But the final -- he spent one or two classes 'preparing' us for what would be on it, but it a lot was unrelated to what we spent months practicing and learning.

(Spring 2023) Went into his class nervous due to his low rating here, then left very confused. He was great! Gave approachable/wholesome dad energy and is clearly very interested in the course content! I think IAT 106 is very over-hated in general as I had a lot of fun in this class! Exams/projects were nothing surprising, just manage your time.

Very dry lectures, I would say the lectures are not useful in person. The midterm is very time constrained and the average was 48%, but the final was fair (COVDID). Homework pretty much every week in labs which can be time consuming. TA marked labs quite strictly and choose a good partner for your two major projects!

Most disorganized course ever taken. TA's and professor are super unhelpful and can't notice when the entire class is fallen behind. TA's seem to be confused about prof's guidance a lot. You learn most on your own, and the labs are the most useful things even if the TA's don't help you much. Lectures are pretty useless, and boring.

Although Halil seems like a nice guy, he lacks a lot in terms of his teaching. Instructions on assignments were barely conveyed and when questions were asked, they weren't answered clearly. Majority of the class failed the midterm. Lectures and slides were super dry and barely explained key terms and ideas for the course.

Terrible prof. Avoid at all costs. Instructions unclear. Point out all problems but does not have any suggestions on what could be changed. Feedback terrible. Does not care about students. Goes on phone during presentations. Lectures are pretty dry. Practically just reading from slides. Picks on people randomly during lecture. TAs were very helpful
